description: a(1)=3; if n = Product p_i^e_i, n>1, then a(n) = Product p_{i+2}^e_i.
references: From a puzzle proposed by _Marc LeBrun_.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: a[1] = 3; a[n_] := With[{f = FactorInteger[n]}, Times @@ (Prime[PrimePi[f[[All, 1]]]+2]^f[[All, 2]])]; Array[a, 60] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jun 19 2015 *)
prog: (Haskell)a045966 1 = 3a045966 n = product $ zipWith (^)            (map a101300 $ a027748_row n) (a124010_row n)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 03 2013, Dec 23 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
